      • put

        public void put(com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Entity entity)
        Manual put to Datastore (executed from UserServlet). (each manual put will be executed in an individual transaction)
        Parameters:
        entity - Entity object to put to Datastore

      • get

        public com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Entity get(java.lang.String kind,
                                            java.lang.String id)
                                              throws java.util.InputMismatchException,
                                                     ParseException,
                                                     java.io.IOException,
                                                     ParseException,
                                                     ParseException,
                                                     java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                                     com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException,
                                                     ParseException
        Get an entity from Datastore with current kind and id (lazy migration with Datalog will be started if necessary)
        Parameters:
        kind - Kind of needed entity (e.g. Player)
        id - Id of needed entity (e.g. 1)
        Returns:
        latest entity (even after lazy migration)
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException
        ParseException
        java.io.IOException
        java.net.URISyntaxException
        com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException

      • saveSchemaChange

        public java.lang.String saveSchemaChange(java.lang.String command)
                                  throws java.util.InputMismatchException,
                                         ParseException,
                                         java.io.IOException,
                                         ParseException,
                                         com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException
        Generates rules and adds them to Datastore if a schema change occurs (add, delete, copy, move)
        Parameters:
        command - Command which triggers a schema change
        Returns:
        generated Datalog rules saved in Datastore
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException
        ParseException
        java.io.IOException
        com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException

      • getAllRulesFromDatastore

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllRulesFromDatastore()
        Returns:
        List of datalog rules saved in Datastore

      • getRulesFromMemcache

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getRulesFromMemcache(java.lang.String key)
        Returns all rules with input key from Memcache. If no matching rules exist in Memcache, load matching rules from Datastore to Memcache
        Parameters:
        key - Kind with Schemaversion to load all rules starting with this key
        Returns:
        Specific rules as a List (e.g. all rules starting with "Player2")

      • addRulesToDatastore

        public void addRulesToDatastore(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> newRules)
        Add rules from inputMap to datastore and memcache
        Parameters:
        newRules - as a Map (e.g. key="RulesPlayer2", value="Player2(?id,?name,?score,?ts):-$Player1(?id,?name,?ts)."

                   throws java.util.InputMismatchException,

                          com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException
        Write a datalog fact to Datastore; timestamp will be added automatically
        Parameters:

        Parameters:
        kind - of entity (e.g. Player)
        newAttributesList - list of attribute names (with prefix "?")
        Throws:

      • addNewEntity

        public void addNewEntity(java.lang.String kind)
                  throws com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException,
                         java.util.InputMismatchException
        This method adds a new entity kind to Datastore with default attribute "id"
        Parameters:
        kind - New entity type
        Throws:
        com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException
        java.util.InputMismatchException

      • addStartEntities

        public void addStartEntities()
        This method adds start/test entities to Datastore. Only for test cases - three Player and three Mission entities will be added.
